headline: The Best Parmesan Chicken Bake
description: This chicken bake offers the same flavors as chicken Parmesan but without breading and frying for an easy, irresistibly saucy and cheesy meal.

video.description: This could be the fastest, easiest chicken Parmesan you’ll ever make.
video.name: Easy Chicken Parmesan Bake

name: The Best Parmesan Chicken Bake
recipeIngredient: 2 cloves garlic, crushed and finely chopped
0.25 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste
1 (8 ounce) package shredded mozzarella cheese, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Coat the bottom of a 9x13-inch casserole dish with olive oil, and sprinkle with garlic and red pepper flakes.
Arrange chicken breasts in the bottom of the dish.
Pour marinara sauce over chicken. Sprinkle basil over marinara sauce, and top with 1/2 of the mozzarella cheese, followed by 1/2 of the Parmesan cheese, and croutons.
Top with remaining mozzarella cheese and remaining Parmesan cheese.

Bake in the preheated oven until cheese and croutons are golden brown and the chicken is no longer pink inside, about 35 minutes to an hour, depending on the shape and thickness of your chicken breasts. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a chicken breast should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: This was such a delicious and easy dinner! I followed the recipe and did opt to sear the chicken first which definitely enhanced the flavor. My croutons turned out a little too crunchy for my liking so I would consider adding a little of the chicken pan drippings on top to moisten them up. I would also serve with some noodles due to the husband's insistence that "it is just the way chicken parmesan is done". My bad. It took a good hour to cook through which was a great set-it and forget-it meal. Thanks, Chef John!

I made this exactly as the recipe dictated aside from using dried basil instead because neither my supermarket nor I had any fresh :). The breast halves threw me a little. I'm used to recipes that call for chicken breasts - but I think I've been using halves all along since that's how they are sold. The croutons came out a little soggy since they were touching the sauce, so watch out for that, but otherwise the flavor and texture was excellent.

This was delicious, I had the time, so I marinated the chicken breast in a bit of olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, crushed red pepper and salt, instead just putting those in the bottom of the baking dish. I used homemade marinara. Otherwise, I followed the directions and baked until done. I really like the flavor and ease of cooking. Served with a simple salad, it was an excellent meal. My croutons didn't retain a lot of crunch, so I might just leave them off next time and serve with a nice crusty bread.
I forgot the garlic croutons! But it turned really yummy anyways! Next time I will use the croutons and try a homemade marinara sauce.
Not a fan. Won't make this again.
The recipe is great. I add a little more cheese , but other than that it's delicious.

Well - with a recipe this inventive, straightforward and this popular, I thought why should I be restricted from trying it just because I don’t eat much chicken? I’m not saying it’s my Food Wish, but I made a tempeh-turnip-tater version (using what’s at hand, you know how it is.) This recipe is perfectly suited for tempeh, I think, and it’s great with rutabagas and potatoes as well. 45 mins in the oven. Thanks Chef John!
Great and innovative! I've never seen this kind of recipe before! Definitely making it again!

this meal tasted terrific. someone suggested to sear the chicken before placing in casserole dish and that did the trick. cooked for over an hour, but I expected that. now this is in our monthly rotation

I used panko bread crumbs as I was out of croutons but this was a big hit with the whole family. Hardly any leftovers but I had some for lunch the next day and they were great. I reheated them on the stove top to retain crunchiness - yum!

Really good dinner. It could use a little bit more sauce, but otherwise it’s great! I didn’t have croutons, so I used seasoned Panko breadcrumbs mixed with a little melted butter for the topcoat. The hubby and I both really enjoyed this! This is a keeper!
An easy go-to family favorite.

Where has this recipe been all my life? Even my critical husband raved about this dish. I had 1 cup of Wegman's Smooth Marinara left over and 1 T. garlic infused olive oil to use so made this. To save money and insure even cooking, I cut large boneless breasts horizontally and pound each half in a Ziploc so used 2 pounded halves for one half recipe. IMPORTANT: I reduced the baking time to 25 min. -- perfect. I plated it with a cauliflower, broccoli, cherry tomato side. Practically no carbs and didn't miss them. I crumbled garlic herb bruschetta crackers over the sauce instead of croutons, some from a holiday gift basket. I didn't season the chicken since all the rest of the ingredients packed flavor. Fresh basil from my plants. Best Chicken Parm ever. This goes into my Judie's Best notebook. Thanks Chef John.

Because I recently had to go gluten free, the fact that there was no breading appealed to me. Needless to say I also did not use the croutons. For me this recipe worked. I used skinless, boneless chicken legs because that's what I had and lightly browned them. Topped with Prego Chunky Garden style sauce, sprinkled with Italian seasoning, garlic and onion powder and topped with lots of Mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. I chose to top with aluminum foil that was pierced and will not do that again. It became too watery from the steam even though I had lots of large holes. Instead I will cook uncovered and top with cheese later in the cooking cycle. All in all this was a quick dinner that fit my new dietary needs and is easily adaptable to ingredients on hand.
Added onions to the skillet after browning the chicken. Deglazed with chick stock and warmed the maranara. Have never had a Chef John creation.

It was simple and tasted good enough. I’ll make it again as a quick meal for the family. I made it following the recipe with no changes because I wanted a reference point prior to making any changes. I think next time I may crush the croutons and brown the chicken breasts. As someone who cooks a lot of gourmet dishes, it’s a good substitute for a night when time is at a premium.

Exceptionally easy to make, and pan searing the chicken breast for about 1-2 minutes per side on medium high heat before putting it in the casserole dish definitely improves the dish a lot. Would absolutely make this again, as it was a very easy meal to make for a large gathering.
Loved it. Only problem is I used large chicken breasts and needed to bake longer than I should have (croutons and cheese didn't appreciate it). Cooking again ;)
I love this so - so easy and delicious. Can be used for vegetarian chicken cutlets as well.
Easy to do recipe. Kids loved it as well as my wife and her friend.

My husband and I enjoyed this a great deal and it was a nice change from the usual. Instead of croutons I sprinkled the top generously with Panko bread crumbs because I didn't have any in the pantry. I'll make again with the croutons, as written.
I'd recommend seasoning the chicken with salt and pepper before layering ingredients on top. Quick, easy and good!

Even the pickiest kid ate this and my husband loved it. This is SOOO easy. You can skip a couple steps and still end up with a great dish...it's very forgiving. I think the key is to use the brand of spaghetti sauce that your family loves. I cut the chicken breasts into strips so it would cook faster and I didn't bother layering precisely...just chicken, whole jar of spag sauce, moz cheese, bread crumbs (didn't have croutons), parm cheese. Bake. I also baked it at a higher temp so the cheese browned. Awesome! My kids asked me to put it into the regular rotation...lucky me!

The recipe is really easy, for the chicken I found some garlic and herb seasoned chicken breast and thought those might add a little more flavor to the recipe and I used an Italian blend of cheese and Italian flavored croutons.

This is a great recipe. I usually put a little sauce on bottom of pan, then add the oil and pepper flakes. Good chicken Parm flavor without all the fuss. Add some pasta and a vegetable or salad and you have a great, easy meal.
Very easy to make!! Tastes delicious and very cheesy!! We loved this casserole and plan to make it again and again ❤❤❤

As per Allrecipes' video, I seasoned the chicken on both sides with salt and pepper and then browned. I was cooking bacon previously, so I browned the chicken in the bacon fat. This step will reduce your baking time, mine cooked in 35 mins. Also, a small baking dish makes more sense, since 2 cups of sauce is really not enough to make a "casserole" style dish in a 13" x 9".

I made this recipe but I tweaked it a little bit by putting two cloves of garlic crushed and a couple of tablespoons of olive oil on the bottom of the pan I layered the chicken which i cut into big chunks and then I put the sauce over it and then I used different Italian cheeses five cheese blend mozzarella,Parmesan and fontina cheeses, then sprinkled basil or use oregano on top then I used Panko breadcrumbs and I sprinkled a little garlic powder on top baked it for 50 minuets everybody loved it it was the best recipe I can’t wait to make it again

Overall as is, I think it was good. However, when I make it again, I'll probably save some marinara for the pasta because the chicken soaked most of it up. I'll also use more cheese because I really wanted a thicker layer on top. I used bread crumbs on top instead of croutons and gave it a spray with olive oil and it worked perfectly. Definitely will make again, just with a few personal changes.
Glad I didn’t read the negative reviews before I made this! Made it just as the recipe and video showed…it was fantastic! I will definitely be making this again.
Fanfreakin'tastic! We loved this! Made as per the recipe and will definitely make this again. So easy and flavourful.

Made this for a family dinner, but I would not hesitate to serve it to guests. Add a lovely salad and a baguette; purchased biscotti & gelato for desert... SET! I did use lots of fresh basil and additional garlic.
Love this. Only change I made was to cut the chicken into chunks prior to cooking. It is very savory.
We loved it

I broke the croutons up a little smaller since other reviewers recommended that. Otherwise I followed exactly. We really loved this dish and would add it to my regular rotation. It was quicker and less clean up than regular chicken parmesan. My husband loved the crunchier crouton pieces.
This was a hit for the whole family.

I make Chef John recipes all the time. This was the first one that wasn't great. Perhaps because the chicken was thicker, it didn't seem to absorb the flavors particularly well even though I did cut the breasts into smaller pieces. If I made this again, I would flatten the chicken some. I would rather find the time to make "real" Chicken Parmesan the regular way when we're in the mood for it rather than taking this shortcut.

I made this exactly as directed and baked for 35 minutes. The chicken’s internal temperature was 165-170 but it was tough. The croutons on top were almost burnt. Actually the croutons had a lot more flavor straight out of the bag than they did after they were baked on this dish. I will not make it again.
This was soo easy! I made it as directed and it was a hit! I served it over some spaghetti noodles drizzled with olive oil. Will definitely make again.
Fabulous!

The elements of chicken parm were here except for the lightly crisp breading. I did butterfly the breast and 35 mins was good time for baking. Would rate this 3 stars but give it an extra star for simplicity and speed.

Easy and tasty! I followed the recipe except used thighs and added french fried onion rings along with the croutons. I seared the thighs before putting in the casserole, but won't bother with that step next time as it wasn't necessary. It took about an hour to bake. I did as other suggested & covered the dish half-way through baking to avoid burning the croutons.
This is delicious and very easy to put together!!
Absolutely delicious. I used tenders and GF breadcrumbs. Will make a gain this week!!

This recipe is delicious! I am GF so I did not use the croutons & served it with GF spaghetti. I also pounded the chicken & it was perfectly cooked in 30 minutes. Can’t wait to make it again! Highly recommend!!!

This recipe is very tasty and and easy to make. I think I would crush the croutons a little (and yes, I used small croutons). Other than that, it was very good. I think I baked mine a bit too long, so be mindful of the time.
This was the most horrible recipe I have made in a long time! The chicken was rubbery, not done in the recommended time and after cooking it longer the other ingredients were much to be desired!

This recipe was very good the first night we had it but the leftovers were not very good. It's only the two of us, so most of the recipes I make end up with leftovers, which we love and depend on for other meals during the week. This recipe however was terrible as a leftover...the croutons were very soggy and had soaked up the sauce so the rest of the dish was very dry. Because of this I won't make this again as half the dish is eaten as a leftover & we didn't enjoy it at all. My hubby couldn't even eat his as a leftover, it was that bad.

Tasty! A few changes I made:
- Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces before covering with sauce and cheese and baking
- Sprinkled Italian seasoning over cheese for extra flavor
- Used panko breadcrumbs instead of croutons and sprayed them with olive oil
- Added ingredients in this order: olive oil, red pepper flakes, garlic, chicken, sauce, mozzarella cheese. Covered tightly with foil and baked for 30 minutes. Uncovered, added Parmesan and panko, sprayed with olive oil, and baked on a higher rack for an additional 15 minutes to brown.
I used too much sauce and it turned watery, but still worth making. Will use less sauce next time.

Very good. Excellent idea to use croutons. I'm reviewing mostly to capture my personal notes, for myself. Made my own sauce, added the garlic, basil, and pepper flakes to the sauce, then coated the baking dish with a thin layer of sauce before adding the chicken. I had four BSCB, an average eight ounces each. The chicken needs to be seasoned! Even with the sauce, cheese, and croutons, the chicken itself was bland. I used Rothbury Seasoned Croutons, which I keep on hand and use not only for salads, but as crackers in different kinds of soups. (I like them because the cubes are small, but I did crush them a bit before adding to the casserole.) I didn't have/use Parmesan. I baked four BSCB in a 9X13 baking dish with the cheese and croutons. Then, put a bit of sauce on cooked rigatoni, put the rigatoni in two 9X9 baking dishes. When the chicken was done, I put half on top of the rigatoni in each of the smaller baking dishes. I read one review that cut the chicken into cubes before baking and will try that next time. Overall, the dish was good. The biggest drawback to me was the bland chicken, which is an easy fix. I will make this again.

Diffantly a keeper so good so easy no chopping my chicken was nice and juicy. but I poured my my rinsed out sauce jar mid way through baking as I thought it would be too dry. That made my croutons mushy
Very tasty. I used partially thawed chicken breasts. As a result it took longer to cook, resulting in crusty cheeze and more liquid than I think it was supposed to make. Lesson learned.

Had no marinara or croutons, so I used tomato sauce (about 3 cups) and made my own croutons.
Served with pasta and salad.
Yum!

For the preparation ease and speed, this makes a nice supper with a salad. The fresh garlic at the bottom of the dish infuses the chicken with great taste. The croutons at the top reinforce that and add a breading-like component without the breading and frying. Also bakes quickly! I have used dried basil in a pinch and it works, just takes away that freshness. Really a terrific recipe for weeknights!

Nice recipe! Go easy on the salt when seasoning the chicken breasts. There may be a fair amount of it in a prepared pasta auce already. Also, I added 4 minced cloves of garlic in the pan as opposed to the 2 called for in the ingedients list. One can never have too much garlic.

I have to say that I almost always agree with the positive reviews. This time I do not. I followed the recipe as written. It tasted like chicken with sauce, cheese and croutons on top. I'll pass on making this again.
It was quick and easy. I'll make it again only because of that.
Quick and easy, great flavor. I used thin sliced chicken breasts.
This was pretty good. I added a bit more garlic than called for. Not sure what went wrong but the croutons were completely soggy and not very appealing.
God Bless Chef John! This is easy and delicious!
We loved it. An excellent recipe and very easy to make. I didn't change anything.
Wont make this recipe again. It was too bland for our taste.

I made this exactly as recipe stated (except used a variety of shredded cheese as I only had a bit of mozzarella) It was SO fast and easy and 2 teenage boys & spouse Loved It !! None leftover (o:)
This is a perfect weeknight meal.

I liked this recipe. My only adjustment would be to rectify salt and freshly ground pepper. Try to find the best mozzarella you can also not just the Parmesan to make for a very good bake. The cheese is what makes this recipe. Also, adjust the baking time because the chicken breast without a pre-searing will not cook as fast. This recipe in my opinion can also substitute the marinara for any other store bought tomato sauces available to vary the flavor. Will make it again. You may also be able to prepare ahead and just bake the next day.
This is a keeper and anyone that said it has no flavor did you follow the instructions because this is definitely delicious

Chef John THANK YOU! I loved this take on Chicken Parmesan! I read a ton of reviews as I always do to get pointers. Should I crush the croutons? Should I leave them whole? Etc... people make this recipe as is! Watch the video. Definitely push the croutons into the sauce to be sure they aren’t just vulnerable at the top to get too crispy. Everyone loved this. I’ll make this often! Give it a shot! You won’t be disappointed!
This was great. Very easy. The family, including 7-year-old granddaughter who's a picky eater, loved it. I will make this again. (I let it bake for about one hour.)

It was an easy dish to throw in the oven and smelled amazing. I would make it again if it got better reviews from my family but even my husband didn't clean his plate and called it "interesting"... Code word for don't make again. I think I liked that it was easy but not great.

Surprisingly good! I was skeptical, but it came out really good and pretty similar to regular chicken parm. I cut the chicken breasts in half thickness-wise and also seasoned them with ms. dash. After 45 minutes the breasts were at 160 degrees.
Really easy and good. I crushed up my croutons and sprinkled them on top instead of leaving whole. Served with garlic toast and a salad. Easy weeknight dinner
This was great everyone loved it! Even the one who hates Chicken Parmesan.

This was not my favorite. Half of the croutons were soggy and the other half were hard as rocks. The cheese baked into a shell that was hard to cut through with a sharp knife and even harder to cut through and eat with a fork. The flavors were too muted as well for my preference. The chicken itself cooked well, but overall, I will never make this again.

Nice flavor but this was Chicken Parm Soup. I followed the directions in the written recipe and it came out extremely watery. Such a disappointment. I'm willing to try it one more time but do as the video suggests and sear the chicken first since that should render out some of the liquid.
Awesome!!! I used Sante Fe tortilla strips instead of croutons.. It was delicious...

If you haven’t tried this yet you are missing out. The only thing I did different was cubed up the chicken. It’s fabulous, easy and no matter how much I make there are never any left overs. Thank you Chef John!!
super easy, and very delicious
I didn’t change anything, I trust Chef John’s judgment completely with all his receptors. It was amazing!
It was so easy to make and everyone enjoyed it. I will definitely make again.
Cubed the chicken, rather than leaving it as a chicken breast. It still took almost 1 hour to bake. Other than that, made it as is and it was pretty good
Don’t know what happened but sauce was so watered down. Bottom half of Pan was water. Sauce was gone.

This dish was amazing! We've served with a variety of sides from veggie noodles to roasted veggies to regular pasta. I've added my own sauce, jarred sauce and even used just plain tomatoes with some leftover pizza sauce. But you need to try the recipe as written also! The basil kicks it up! It's amazing!
My entire family loved it...that is a very rare occurrence. I used chicken tenders and baked for 35 minutes and a little extra marinara. It was so easy and good!
I made this last night and my family loved it. Will be making this again. Thank you for sharing .
This was a great recipe. I did make my own marinara sauce instead of canned. Next time I will take the advice of others to crush up the croutons a bit. My family loved it and it was quick and easy.
Very Easy and great flavor! Add fresh basil - it makes a big difference.
Delicious! I used powdered garlic and omitted the red pepper flakes. I served it with a tossed salad and store bought garlic bread. I will be making it again.

I made the recipe exactly as written, except I added more parmesan cheese. You have to watch the casserole carefully toward the end of the baking time, because the tips of the croutons can burn. Mine would have been done in 30-35 minutes, rather than 40. But it was still really delicious and so fast to put together!

I made this recipe with pessimism, but what the heck, my husband bless his heart, he who is a world traveler throughout his 80 years will eat anything, so I felt pretty safe. The thing is I didn't want to critique a recipe unless I tried it, as I thought this recipe could be improved. It doesn't need to have juice left on the bottom while the chicken is left pretty dry. These two issues were the result of following the directions to the letter. I'm going to make my adjustments and present the recipe under a new title...maybe even #2 or #3, it's just that I have so many changes I might as well rather than incur the wrath of those who say "why make the changes if you're not going to call it your own, and my gosh....we've all heard the complaints!
One of my favorites! Used less red pepper flakes as my partner doesn’t like too much spice. I used organic basil tomato sauce, organic chicken breasts, and organic cheese. It was so tasty!
The recipe was easy to make and it turned out marvelous. I would recommend this to anyone!
Very easy , delicious and healthy . Well done !
Great way to have chicken parmesan. Easy to put together and a nice change to traditional chicken parmigiana . Will definitely make again
Chicken needed more flavor, probably should have been marinated.

This probably isn’t the BEST chicken parmigiana but it was tasty, super simple to make and probably a bit lower on calories than a more traditional recipe. My husband liked it and I will make it again.
We liked it, but it wasn't the best parmesan chicken. The garlic croutons were pretty mushy after being baked, which made the texture harder for us to enjoy.

Easy to cook and amazing taste, 
Thank you.
Delicious and easy! Only thing I did differently from written recipe was to crush up croutons before putting them on! It was delicious!!

I absolutely loved this recipe. I always follow the directions the first time and would change the next time, but this does not need any changes other than I cut up my chicken into cubes - this was delicious!!!!! thank you so much for this recipe!!
Very good! Easy to make & tasty! Crushed the croutons first. It bakes for an hour.
